title: For Sale/Trade:  MAGNUM RESEARCH MR 9QA
postcontent: This is the first striker fired gun that Magnum Research has built. They bought the polymer lowers from Walther ( basically the P99) and finished off the gun in their Minnesota plant with their steel parts. It fits the hand real well amd has good balance. It is a quick action which means that once the slide is pulled back the trigger is at half cocked and takes very little to pull. As it cycles it returns to the half cocked position each time. Once you have chambered a round there is a decocker. Once this is done the first pull on the trigger is longer and each pull after that is the shorter. It is advisable that when you are carrying it to have it in the decocked position. If you were to take out the weapon in the half cocked position it would take very little to pressure to go off. It has 2- 17 round magazines and a hard case that it came on. I bought it new a little over a year ago and have put about 400-500 rounds through it. It is in excellent condidtion.

What you have here is a beautiful Romanian or Rommy G AK-47.
They were originally made for the Romanin Patriotic Guard. The Romanian 'G' has a chrome lined bore, and many were hardly ever fired. title: For Sale:  Browning MKI* Inglis
postcontent:
Browning MKI*: $800 (Comes with 2 mags service holster with cleaning rod) 
Browning Hi-Power pistols were used during World War II by both Allied and Axis forces. After occupying Belgium in 1940, German forces took over the FN plant. German troops subsequently used the Hi-Power, having assigned it the designation Pistole 640(b) ("b" for belgisch, "Belgian"). Examples produced by FN in Belgium under German occupation bear German inspection and acceptance marks, or Waffenamts, such as WaA613. In German service, it was used mainly by Waffen-SS and Fallschirmjäger personnel.

Hi-Power pistols were also produced in Canada for Allied use, by John Inglis and Company in Toronto. The plans were sent from the FN factory to Britain when it became clear the Belgian plant would fall into German hands, enabling the Inglis factory to be tooled up for Hi-Power production for Allied use. Inglis produced two versions of the Hi-Power, one with a fixed rear sight and one with an adjustable rear sight and detachable shoulder stock (primarily for a Nationalist Chinese contract). The pistol was popular with the British airborne forces as well as covert operations and commando groups such as the Special Operations Executive (SOE), the U.S. Office of Strategic Services (OSS) and the nascent British Special Air Service (SAS) Regiment.

title: For Sale:  1976 F-150 4X4 Short-wide Box
postcontent:
For Sale 1976 Ford F-100 4X4 Short Wide Box.  I am the original owner, it has 141000 original miles, and is partially restored; it has a balanced and blue-printed 390 cubic inch engine with 10.5 to 1 forged pistons, an RV cam, 10-quart oil pan, high velocity oil pump, all the Edelbrock high-rise parts, 600 carb,  air-cleaner and valve covers.  The front end has been completely gone through, with new knuckle joints, Warn hubs, new steering arms, and it has the Rancho 3-inch lift kit with dual shocks in front and the spring kit and single shocks in the rear, a Detroit Locker rear end, Hellwig Over-loads leaf-spring helpers, full towing package with brake kit.  It has 35-inch aluminum slotted rims, and Wild Country RVT Radial tires I would estimate about 50% tread remaining.
I spent over $20,000 invested in the truck, and then gave it to my son to finish, who has been in the Army since 2000, and is stationed over seas, and it has been in storage ever since.  The only thing left to complete is the bodywork and paint.  There is minimal rust, and the bed and box is solid, no rust in the places that kills these, because I was anal about washing this thing’s underbelly.  There are also numerous boxes of extra parts that we gathered over the years to use to complete the project.  It also has a Sony hi-end stereo system and power amp and it has a Roll bar, custom made tonneau cover.  My son now wants to sell it and buy a new truck on his retirement after his 20-years in the service.
The 15-Kicker speakers that fits nicely behind the seat,  and a pair of brand new still in the box unmounted $400.00 Bosch clear running lights; as well as a brand new $900.00 Mallory distributor with cap and wires, and with spare cap  that I will throw in if the asking price is met.  This is an excellent project truck to complete with a little time and elbow grease for the backyard mechanic; however, sitting for the last 12 years in my cousin’s machine shed, has shown me that it was neglected just by sitting there and even though it was on concrete, and varmint free, it still sat for 12 years and that is why I have reduced the price.  It is barn fresh, and while it was stored in a decent environment, it will need work to restore it properly.

postcontent:
VERY GOOD CONDITION.

Comes as pictured with:

Two 3-round Magazines

Ramline 27881 Syn-Tech Stock - Black - Great Condition
Specifications: - Precision molded, glass-filled polycarbonate - Strong, lightweight - Free-floating barrel design improves accuracy - Weather-resistant - LOP can be shortened up to 2'' - Includes: premium recoil pad & swivel studs - For: 788 (.308, 6mm, .243)

Original wood stock included. Good Condition.

Nikon ProStaff 2-7 x 32 Black Matte Riflescope with 2pc. Weaver Mount 75/76 and Rings.

Harris Ultralight Bipod Series 1A2, Extends 12" to 25".

and AMMO:
5 Boxes of 20 Rounds Federal 243 Win. 100 grain soft point

Private sale to Ohio resident or will ship anywhere in the lower 48 States for $40.00 from FFL to FFL, ammo will ship separated. Payment by USPS money order. Buyer is responsible to know and abide by local, state, and federal regulations.

Open for trade. Please email what you have, straight trade or cash difference.  

******

The Remington 788 is an iconic and accurate hunting rifle developed by the Remington Arms Company. The 788 utilizes a single-column detachable magazine holding 3 rounds. The distinguishing feature of the 788 is its rear-lugged bolt. The bolt has 9 lugs in three rows of three lugs each. They lock into the receiver behind the magazine well. Because of this design, the bolt handle lifts only 60 degrees on opening giving more clearance for scopes compared to the 90 degrees required for the Model 700 and other two-lugged bolts. The bolt travel is also reduced because of the rear lugs. The receiver also has a small ejection port and no bolt lug raceways, making the receiver stiffer than a Remington 700, although it is the same outside diameter. Remington made extensive use of 'screw-machines' in the manufacture of this rifle. The 788 was discontinued in the 1980s. In its used form, the 788 retains a cult following for its accuracy.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Imperial German Gew. 88 S Commission Rifle 1890
postcontent:
Imperial German M.1888 S "Commission" rifle in 8 mm caliber. Made by Ludwig Loewe Factory, Berlin, Germany in 1890, and accordingly marked on the receiver. The receiver displays a letter "S" (the rifle was converted to fire S-ammunition or "spitzer"). Stamped on right side of the receiver is "G.Mod.88" in old english writing. This indicates the Gewher Model 88. Absolutely no rust. Very nice patina on barrel shroud and receiver. No import stamps. Stock shows dings and dents and one repair spot. Original German stamps on the wood as well. Bore is bright and shiny with no rust or pitting. Looking to trade for a nice ar15 or maybe other guns as well. Might sell outright. One of the primary reasons for the .30-30's popularity amongst deer hunters is its light recoil. Average recoil from a typical 150-grain (9.7 g) load at 2,390 feet per second (730 m/s) in a 7.5-pound (3.4 kg) rifle is 10.6 pounds-force (47 N) of felt recoil at the shooter's shoulder. This, combined with the cartridge's ability to take the majority of large game in North America, as long as the game is within 200 yards (180 m) of the shooter, results in a highly effective hunting round.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Ciener 1911 A1 .22 Conversion Kit
location: Leslie, Marshall, Clinton, Arkansas, United States
postcontent: I have for sale a Ciener .22 1911 conversion kit with one 15 rnd. mag for $215. I bought it from MidwayUSA about a year ago. I have shot approx. 200 or so rounds through it using my brothers 1911, and I did have a little trouble with it jamming every once in awhile, (especially at first). I later read that Ciener recommended shooting higher velocity .22 for breaking it in, but I never got to try it. I noticed on the slide after I'd had it for awhile, that someone had marked faintly with a marker "2nd". The only reason for marking it as a 2nd that I can think of, is that when I got it the finish was worn off the rear sight. My brother has a Ciener conversion kit that is pretty much identical to this one, it looks and works the same, and his wasn't marked as a 2nd, so I think it was only the worn finish on the rear sight that caused it to be marked that way.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Hitachi 10" Dual Sliding Compound Miter Saw
postcontent:
Hitachi C10FS as the Clydesdale of all the industry's sliding compound miter saw workhorses. It's tough, well built, and feature packed. One of the few saws on the market that bevels to both sides, the Hitachi lets you make compound cuts to the right or left without the hassle of transferring marks or repositioning stock

Unlike other top-heavy saws, the Hitachi remains well balanced and easy to maneuver--which, along with its smooth-operating blade guard, makes it a relatively safe saw to use. The saw's table allows a good miter range, swinging 57 degrees right and 46 degrees left, and the unique bevel and miter scale makes cutting crown molding a snap whether you're an expert or a novice.

Hitachi's multi-V-belt soft-start transfer delivers power smoothly. The saw doesn't jump or buck on start-up, so cuts are generally safe and easy to keep true. The saw cuts 3-1/2- to 12-inch stock at a 90-degree miter, and at 45 degrees the saw handles a 9-inch cut. We also like that the Hitachi features adjustable plastic fences that give support when cutting small pieces close to the blade.

title: For Sale:  4-Piece Modular Sleep System (NEW)
postcontent:
Modular Sleep System - 4 Part

The MSS sleeping bags are constructed to be used in conjunction with each other, or separately to complete a system known as the extreme cold weather sleeping bag. The MSS is designed to provide comfort in temperatures ranging from 50°F to -30°F.  This means one can sleep comfortably at these temperatures with the appropriate combination of the sleep system. 
The Waterproof Bivy Cover is produced utilizing GORE-TEX, a waterproof, moisture-vapor-permeable material with all seams heat sealed. The Compression Stuff Sack is constructed with water resistant materials with adequate volume for both bags as well as the bivy cover. This unique stuff sack compresses the system to one cubit foot. 
The 4-Part Modular Sleep System includes: 
•Green Patrol Bag 
•Black Intermediate Bag 
•Woodland Camouflage GORE-TEX Waterproof Bivy Cover 
•Black Compression Stuff Sack 
NOTE FROM SELLER:
To keep your sleep system lasting for years to come, here are some things I do with my personal gear: 
1)	When not using your sleep system, keep it in a large storage bag such as a large nylon laundry bag. I get mine at WalMart or Target.  These bags are usually blue or green and will hold the entire system.  The reason for this is not to compress the synthetic fibers that fill the sleep system.  If kept in the stuff sack for long periods of time the sleep system will lose loft causing the sleep system to become less likely to keep you warm when needed most. 
2)	Over time, the Gore-Tex Bivy cover will lose some of its water repellency. This all depends on the amount of use and how clean you keep the gear.  Once a year I treat all of my Gore-Tex equipment with a two part system:
	First I wash all of my Gore-Tex gear with NIKWAX-TECH WASH.  Making sure you follow the instructions on the 	bottle.  The Tech Wash will thoroughly clean the Gore-Tex fibers and other synthetic water resistant gear one 	may have. 
	Second, I rewash using NIKWAX TX-DIRECT.  This will refortify the waterproofness of any Gore-Tex or synthetic 	gear you may have.  
IN ADDITION, PLEASE READ THE CARE LABELS FOR ALL OF YOUR GEAR WHEN WASHING OR DRYING ANY SYNTHETIC MATERIAL. 
Thank you for looking.

title: For Sale/Trade:   Smith and Wesson Revolver
postcontent:
For sale or trade, a Smith and Wesson M&P in .38 Specail with a 6 inch barrel. It's not the Model 1905 or Model 10, S&W just called it a .38 Military & Police. A transitional (post-WW II) gun had some features of a pre-WW II model and some of the later version; some major stuff like the long vs. short action, and some minor features like the shape of the ejector rod tip and frame stampings. It is essentially identical to a 1905 Fourth Change except that it has the postwar hammer safety block. That was a big engineering change and probably deserves to be reflected in the nomenclature. 

These transitional S-prefix guns are transitional between the wartime Victory models and the short-action M&P that was introduced in 1948. The gun was probably shipped in 1946. It is a very low serial number for the isolated S-prefix; like guns of that particular era with a 6-inch barrel were also very uncommon. All serial numbers match, it's all original, locks up tight, shoots like a dream. I does show holster wear. The SV prefix (still conceptually part of the Victory series, though military victory had been achieved several months earlier) was last seen on guns with serial numbers in the SV811xxx range. As stated above, the "S" in the serial number means it has a new hammer-blocking safety device, and that feature was introduced for the Victory K Model in late WWII. 

I'm asking $340. or am willing to work on a trade or  am willing to entertain any other offers. These transitional pieces with a six inch barrel don't pop up to often anymore. I'm cutting down to only three pistol calibers, so here's a chance to add to your S&W collection.
